summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 2020, with earlier threads dating back to December 2019, between the FBI/U.S. Attorney's Office and FirstBank Puerto Rico regarding a federal grand jury subpoena. The U.S. Attorney's Office is attempting to serve and enforce a subpoena for bank records, citing delinquency and threatening court action. The bank's customer service initially fails to properly process the request.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York
persons.context: Sends the final email in March 2020, attaching the subpoena and asking when materials will be produced.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary correspondent attempting to serve and enforce a criminal grand jury subpoena on FirstBank Puerto Rico, threatening court action for non-compliance.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Both are law enforcement/legal officials from the same investigation (FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office) corresponding about the same grand jury subpoena.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is attempting to compel the bank to produce documents under a subpoena, with the bank being non-responsive.

events.title: Initial Subpoena Submission
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney initially attempts to serve a criminal grand jury subpoena on FirstBank Puerto Rico via email, but the bank's system rejects it.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Subpoena Served and Received
events.description: The federal grand jury subpoena is successfully served and received by FirstBank Puerto Rico, as confirmed by a customer service fax receipt.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Subpoena Return Deadline
events.description: The deadline for FirstBank to produce materials in response to the subpoena passes without a response, making the bank delinquent.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Prosecutor Follow-Up on Delinquency
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney follows up, noting the bank is delinquent and threatening to seek court enforcement of the subpoena.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: FBI Agent Final Request
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends a final email attaching the subpoena and asking when the materials will be produced.

locations: Ave. Munoz Rivera 1130, Rio Piedras, PR 00927
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was served on FirstBank Puerto Rico on January 3, 2020, with a return deadline of January 15, 2020.
By late January 2020, FirstBank was delinquent in its response to the subpoena, prompting threats of court enforcement from the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The subpoena is related to a criminal grand jury investigation, indicating an active federal probe, likely connected to the Epstein case given the document set.
Communication issues plagued the process, with the bank's customer service initially failing to register the request and providing unclear points of contact for its legal department.
The correspondence shows persistent efforts by the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI to secure bank records, highlighting the investigative focus on financial transactions.
